DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not there is a history of mouth symptoms.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system._The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.

Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
